alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Knott; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 5:56PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Harlan, Letcher, southeastern Perry, southern Knott and southwestern Pike Counties through 630 PM EST... At 555 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Littcarr to Flint to Rosspoint. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Letcher, Bath, Blackey, May, Nealy, Omaha, Pine Top, Day, Dongola and Ivan around 600 PM EST. Whitesburg, Ermine, Colly, Oven Fork, Mayking, Marlowe, Bellcraft, Deane, Sergent and Democrat around 605 PM EST. Fleming-Neon, Diane, Hiram, Speight, Wright, Gilley, Thornton, Winters, Whitaker and Millstone around 610 PM EST. Jenkins, Benham, Kingdom Come S.P., Clutts, Gordon, Payne Gap, Myra, Fishpond Lake, Gaskill and Dorton around 615 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Lynch, Lewis Creek, Partridge, Blair, Linefork, Burdine, Adamson, Shelby Gap, Rockhouse, Maggard, Lookout and Eolia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for southeastern Kentucky.
